website_summaries.verdict: An Intel processor that will help you take your gaming experiences to new heights at a decent price.
pros: Offers up to 3.6 GHz turbo frequency
Designed to help users play video games in higher resolution and at faster speeds than ever before
Activates in less than 1 second after installation
Delivers 3 times the battery life of comparable processors
cons: Video playback may be choppy at times

customer_reviews.title: Sauce
customer_reviews.text: It's actually pretty fast. Seriously, don't knock it just because it isn't the latest, greatest, bestest. I definitely don't regret buying this over my usual AMDs. And don't get me wrong, I like AMD, but honestly, if you're just looking for something for steady gaming but don't wanna spend a ridiculous amount, you found it. The stock fan is meh, better than expected, but an aftermarket fan would obviously be better. It is not unlocked, so don't bother if you're trying to overclock. I've had this for about a year, and I have yet to run into anything wrong with it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe King

customer_reviews.title: Pairs amazingly well with my GTX 1070ti! Make sure ...
customer_reviews.text: Pairs amazingly well with my GTX 1070ti! Make sure you check to see its combatible with your motherboard! When i bought this, it was not combatible with mine so i had to buy a new motherboard. It wasnt a big deal, i needed one anyway, but still.
customer_reviews.author: Mega-moto-lomaniac

customer_reviews.title: A great buy definitely don't regret
customer_reviews.text: This is an all around great CPU I bought this two years ago now and have not run into any issues I'm also using stock fan since this is not a k and not overclackable this is a good investment if you're looking for a reliable midrange cpu, but with pics like the new ryzen line up it's kinda outdated for the price right now if you're going for highest clock speeds and number of cores
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Comes with CPU fan.
customer_reviews.text: I am a noob at computers, and I probably should've known this by the size of the box but this comes with a CPU cooler. Yup. I had to return the one I bought and had to pay shipping (ugh...). Please don't make the same mistake as me, lol
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Pahukula

customer_reviews.title: Great, but old news.
customer_reviews.text: Great CPU, but honestly would not recommend now that Ryzen has been released and offers more competitively priced options at this performance level.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Rutstein

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This processor is definitely worth the purchase! I was a little hesitant about getting this CPU at first. But once it arrived and I got it hooked up it was well worth the purchase. I upgraded from a Pentium G4560 and there was a significant difference in performance. If you’re thinking about upgrading your CPU I would recommend getting this processor. If you pair this CPU with the right GPU it will perform well in the gaming department as well. Overall a phenomenal CPU!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: It's just as good and I don't miss the milliseconds I could've gotten ...
customer_reviews.text: Decided to go with the i5 6500 versus paying the additional cash for the higher end 6600/6600K. This processor is incredible. It's just as good and I don't miss the milliseconds I could've gotten from the others. I did use the heatsink this processor came with (The higher end processors come with the chip alone) and it seemed to work out well. It was very easy to snap on the motherboard and was adequate cooling. For anyone who knows what they're doing though, it's always better to go with an aftermarket heatsink to keep your investment cooler. If you're on a budget and want to put the money elsewhere, I would recommend this processor.
customer_reviews.author: Kewster

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used for my first rig. Haven't found a reason to get the I7.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick B.

customer_reviews.title: working great
customer_reviews.text: i needed to update from a pentium processor i was using on a ethryum mining rig i built, back to a gaming rig for 2nd computer, this runs better than the 2500k i was using.
customer_reviews.author: Headupone

customer_reviews.title: Impressive performance
customer_reviews.text: I paired this with an intel 7600p m2 ssd for my boot drive and 16gb of 3000Mhz ram. This PC is super fast! I cannot tell a difference from the i5 versus my 9700k i7 in the majority of computing tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Its an INTEL
customer_reviews.text: Come on it's an Intel! I haven't replaced an Intel processor in FOREVER, they are rock solid. Gamers still swear by AMD but I think Intel has been kickin their tails for the past few years. HOWEVER they cost more, but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Great CPU for gaming! Can handle the loads very well but if you plan on streaming and gaming at the same time I would recommend getting an i7! I can stream and game with some games just fine but when it comes to certain games that hog CPU power like Overwatch you would want to go for the i7 hands down!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Boy power
customer_reviews.text: This is legit only to rub my Diablo 3 bot 24/7. At 720p low settings I pull about 200 FPS o gpu. H170 gaming 3 mobo, 32gb Ram, 500gb m.2 970 Evo.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Jigsaw

customer_reviews.title: Comes with a fan
customer_reviews.text: It comes with a fan; don't be fooled into buying a fan you don't need like I did! Lightly loaded with that stock fan, the CPU temp runs a nice, cool 30C. If you need to run Windows 7, you need a Series 6 CPU. I paired this with a GIGABYTE GA-Z270X-Ultra Gaming board. Very happy with my purchases.
customer_reviews.author: E. E. Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Processor Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Installed the processor in a Shuttle XH170V which uses a mini-ITX form factor and the intel H170 chipset. The processor is cooled using just a heat sink since there is no room for a fan. I ran a burn-in test for 24 hours without any errors. The processor temperature never got above 60c. Very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: kokim

customer_reviews.title: i5 great for gaming
customer_reviews.text: An excellent CPU from the 6th generation but stil feels modern and faster than AMD's offering. Would recommend this CPU for gaming. If you wanna do video editing go for the i7!
customer_reviews.author: art vandelay

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU.
customer_reviews.text: If anyone looking at buying an i5-6500 but reading reviews first because you're building a budget build this is a fantastic CPU. There is no need to spend a ton of extra money for other CPUs. I highly recommend this CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: No overheating, although it's too expensive for its clock speed and cached capabilities, but that's Intel for you.
customer_reviews.author: Hirayoki22

customer_reviews.title: Powerful!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very powerful CPU! I have yet to have a problem with it. Since I play Ark: Survival Evolved, a very resource-hungry and poorly optimized game, this is saying a lot. Ark never lags for me, and I play the full version with high settings.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: love this - love intel - fast shipping - nothing bad to say
customer_reviews.text: love this - love intel - fast shipping - nothing bad to say
customer_reviews.author: Grant Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Works fine so far
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install. But it's better if you buy the cleaning paste to clean the socket. And than don't forget to apply the heat paste.
customer_reviews.author: Anton Paungger

customer_reviews.title: Parts are defective
customer_reviews.text: The product came defective, I spent a large portion of time finding the rest of the parts I needed and when I was ready to put the PC for my son together I realize that the part was defective also confirmed by a professional service in town. I dont see any option to return this part.
customer_reviews.author: RADEL VAZQUEZ

customer_reviews.title: Awesome chip
customer_reviews.text: Used this in a gigabit motherboard and works fine. Good price and fast delivery
customer_reviews.author: Dano B.

customer_reviews.title: I mean honestly do you need a review of an ...
customer_reviews.text: I mean honestly do you need a review of an intel processor? there's nothing special about this one relative to any other intel processor. shrug. intel has their game down. edit: no update about the processor, but I'd like to contest my multi-year-old claim that reviews about intel processors are silly in principle.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. Bought the wrong one but it was good

customer_reviews.title: Gaming CPU
customer_reviews.text: Best gaming processor for the price. Handles gaming with ease. No need to get the 6600k, this will handle every game. Stock cooler is decent. Definitely would recommend buying an aftermarket cooler for long gaming sessions.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great, affordable processor. Purchased for a gaming rig i built a few years ago and has exceeded expectations.

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and get this!
customer_reviews.text: It has been providing rock hard performance, in my gaming rig. My graphics card handles all of the rendering needs and this has run every thing else with ease. This provides true core experience, no hyper-threading, just pure and stable throughput.
customer_reviews.author: Eric, USA

customer_reviews.title: Plus Spectre and Meltdown! What a deal!
customer_reviews.text: Still going strong 1.3 years later. Not sure what you want to know about it. The box is nice?

customer_reviews.title: It does come with stock cooler which sucks and doesn't sit very tight on your mother board

The iGPU (Intel Integrated Graphics 530) are really amazing, even without a dedicated gpu she can play some high end games at low settings and can play games like league and WoW with ease and high settings. Great cpu, runs cool, low power, cant complain.

customer_reviews.title: Seems great to me!
customer_reviews.text: The Intel i5-6500 CPU seemed to be a good choice for a mid to upper level processor. I’m expecting this to last several years. I used the stock cpu fan that came in box. So far, the fan is whisper quiet and the power cable easily reached my motherboard’s header. Installation for both cpu and fan was easy. My build includes the following components: - Corsair Carbide Series Spec-01 -EVGA power supply model 600W (DOA, but 2nd one works great so far.) -Gigabyte H110M-A motherboard -Intel i5-6500 CPU -16GB (2x8GB) Corsair Vengeance DDR4 (CMK16GX4M2A2400C14R) -1TB Seagate HDD (ST1000DM003) -Windows 10 Home Full Version -(Used DVD/CD burner from an older pc)

I was surprised to see how small the heat sink and fan is, I'm sure it does the job but I have an aftermarket and wont be using it anyways. The CPU box was factory sealed and exactly as advertised. I cant believe how cool this chip stays, I'm sure there is tons of room to overclock but I don't really need to. Excellent value!

product_meta.title: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
product_meta.description: With intelligent performance that accelerates in response to demanding tasks, such as playing games and editing photos, the Intel Core i5 processor moves faster when you do. The Intel Core i5 processor automatically allocates processing power where it's needed most. Whether you're creating HD video, composing digital music, editing photos, or playing the coolest PC games - with the Intel Core i5 processor you can multitask with ease and be more productive than ever. Case Temperature 71 Degrees Celsius.
feature_bullets: A new level of intelligent performance
3.20 GHz up to 3.60 GHz Max Turbo Frequency / 6 MB Cache

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,142 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
